Yesterday morning was a nightmare come true. I know Mike has a temper...and it's been bad before, but this....... I woke up to hearing him tell my dog that if he ate one more of his socks he'd put a bullet in his head. So, I come flying into the room and tell him that he'd better never talk to my dog like that again. It becomes a blur...but somehow, we get aruging...then screaming. And I mean, SCREAMING. Before I know it, he kicks over the coffee table and is throwing a glass at me. I duck to avoid the shattering. He then picks up a pillow off the couch and rips it open, throwing the stuffing all over then flings the pillow and hits me in the face so hard I stumble back. As I'm trying to regain balance, he's coming towards me fast. I grab ahold of the blanket I have hanging in the doorway of the living room (to keep cool air in there from my air conditioner), and he rips it out of my hand so hard the entire blanket is ripped down from the pins I had holding it up. He has a fist made and I have just enough time to turn my head out of it's path and he ends up smacking the wall behind me. Hard. His hand is bleeding...he is shaking his bloody hand in my face...he's telling me it's my fault his hand is bleeding. I did it to him. I tell him to not touch me, I grab the phone so it's in my hands and hold it. Everything in me says "call 9-1-1". But I'm scared. I know he's mad. If I call the police, what will he do to me?! So, although I'm shaking violently I tell him to get away from me. Just get away. Leave me alone. Please. Don't touch me. Don't talk to me. Just please go away. I stumble into the bathroom and shut the door behind me (which, unfortunatly, has no lock). I suddenly hear him again...he's screaming. As we were fighting, my dog was chewing another one of his socks. He yells for me to get my "fucking ass" out there and see what my "fucking dog" is doing. I don't respond. I'm dizzy. I'm sick to my stomach. He comes through the bathroom door, sock in hand. He takes the sock, damp from my dogs chewing, and wipes it all over my face and trys to stick it in my mouth... I decide I'm going to leave. I'm running late for work. I'm scattered. I just need to go. He follows me out of the house, telling me I need help. I have mental problems. It's my fault he acts like he does. If I was a normal person, he wouldn't have to do those things to make me listen. I know I don't need help, he does. But I don't dare tell him. I'm scared for my life. I can't sleep. I can't eat. I'm just a shell of what used to be me. This is my life. The life I'm coming to accept.

I went by my grandma and grandpa's old house tonight because I have an Aunt that's staying there until it is sold.  It was the first time I'd been there since my grandfather died in February.  First time I'd been there and neither of them were there (my grandma passed away January 8, 2004).  It was an odd feeling....and it was all I could do to hold back my tears.  

I walked in the house, and first instinct was to look in the kitchen at the table.  There was the chair my grandma was always sitting in, eatting her ice cubes out of the tray.  Next to it, my grandpa's chair where he's play his hand held poker game for hours smoking his cigarettes.  Both chairs were empty.  

I made my way into the living room.  There was the couch I sat on next to my grandma the last time I was with her alive at her home on Christmas Eve 2003.  Acrossed the living room, my grandpa's bed he slept in.  That was the last place I saw him alive....this past Valentine's day when I stopped to give him some small gifts.

The lawn chair my grandma sat in was still on the deck.  She'd sit there for hours just watching the neighborhood.  The red coat grandma loved so much....it's still hanging off the door knob in the kitchen.

Oh my God....it's just hitting me tonight how much I actually do miss them.  And the feeling is almost more then I can handle.  I'd give anything to open that front door and see them at that kitchen table again.....

It's been awhile since I've done a real entry.  Lots going on in my life and in my mind.

Mike and I have been doing a lot of fighting.  To the point where I've just reached my limit.  We got into a really stupid argument a few days ago and some how a stupid argument, that should of been avoided in the first place, escalated into an all out screaming match.  Then, we were fine for a couple of days until this morning-when out of nowhere he feels the need to bring up the other night again and starts in on me again.  And, in all of what he said this morning...he made a comment that suddenly opened my eyes and made me realize that maybe this isn't the life for me.  I won't get into what the comment was, but it was directed towards me and it was cruel and intended to hurt.  I realize the comment was made out of anger and I'm sure he really doesn't mean it or feel that way.  The thing is though, it was said and even if it wasn't ment-it's impact may be what is making me think about breaking off this relationship.

I've done nothing but think all day today.  I thought about my life and where it stands now.  What kind of future I'm going to have if I keep in on this path.  And all the other possibilities this world has out there.  

I went and spent time with my mom this morning after this incident and talking with her helped me out alot.  I know it's an old and annoying saying but....there's lots of fish in the sea.  And I know there is someone out there who can love the real me for who I am.  And I am really truely beginning to think Mike is not that someone.

Mike's highstrung, dependant, cocky, immature.  I'm laid back, a free spirit, independent, grown-up.  I'm tired of always having to explain myself to him all the time.  I'm the type of person who can't stand to be sufforcated, I don't want to be clung too.  If I feel like getting in my car and spending the day alone just driving around....I want to do that with no consequences...without having to explain myself.  I love spending time with people I care about....but I value alone time as well and I never get any of that with him.  I don't want a life that's completely predictable   I want a life that's full of surprises.  I need someone that is in it for the good and the bad....someone who can understand I'm a happy person by nature-but even I have my bad days...and that I'm fine with that.  I want to see the world...I want to break out of here and see what else this world has to offer.  I want to spend a summers eve at the ocean just burrying my feet in the sand and wathing the sun descend from the sky.  I want to go on a safari.  I want to take a stroll in a rainforest.  I want to see the Effiel tower as I walk down a beautiful French street.  I want to go to Mardis Gras and get drunk outta my mind and let loose.  I need someone who wants to be there with me from now until the end....someone who can keep up with all my dreams and wants to see the world over with me.  Someone who doesn't care about how much it costs to see the world over....but cares about how much these dreams mean to me and wants to spend every second experiencing them with me.  I want the kind of life that I can look back on when I'm on my death bed and tell those I love; "I've had fun".

Where is my `someone'?!

I read a bulliten board outside a local church and what it said really hit home with me. It read: Spring; Nature's way of reminding us that life does go on. Alot has happened to me since I last wrote, more then I ever could of imagined. First off, I lost the baby. I had a miscarriage five months into it for reasons unknown. The doctor said it was nothing I did wrong, that sometimes these things just happen. Still, I've blamed myself. If only I'd done thisdifferent, or did that instead.... Next, my grandfather passed away on February 17th. We knew he was sick and that he didn't have long, but his passing still was very unexpected. He was full of cancer and tumors. He ended up bleeding to death in my aunt's arms as they waited for the ambulance at 2:30 in the morning (I believe a tumor or something in his lungs exploded). It kills me to think of all the time I should have spent with him and didn't. I always had something else to do. I found excuses not to go there, because going there and seeing him sick hurt me because I knew there was nothing in the world that I or anyone else could do for him. Last time I saw him was Valentine's Day. Mike and I stopped by and gave him a teddy bear and chocolate covered cherrie's (his favorite). We didn't stay long because we were on our way out to dinner. Now, I wish I skipped dinner and stayed. I wish I could of known that would be the last time I ever saw him. My Aunt Diane gave me back the teddy bear I gave him after he passed and I took it home and buried it in a closet-I can't stand even seeing it because when I see it I remembed him holding it after I gave it to him. The day my Grandpa died, a part of me died along with him. Then came Easter Sunday, March 27th. My Aunt Nancy passed away, also cancer related. She had throat and lung cancer from smoking cigarettes. She was only 55 years old. After watching what she went through....having to be fed through a feeding tube, having to be hooked up to a machine in order to breath....I'll NEVER even think about smoking. She suffered alot, she really did. More then any person should ever have too. I would go home from visting her in the hospital ever night and cry because I couldn't take seeing her that way. My Aunt Nancy was always the party animal in the family...she loved tacos, Pizza Hut Supreme pizzas, Coors Light. She was fun, witty, and a match for the most sarcastic of people. I miss her alot and really wish I had taken time to get to know her better when she was alive. I wish I hadn't waited until she was dying to spend time with her. If anyone out there can learn from my mistakes, do it. Spend time with those you care about. You NEVER are to busy to spend time with family and loved ones, so stop making excuses. Trust me, when it's too late...you will wish you did. But, as I started off my entry saying....life does go on. No matter what happens, we have to deal with it and we have to live out our lives. I know my Aunt Nancy and my Grandpa would be devastated if I sat around mourning them. So, I've been trying even harder to live my life better. I'm still doing the things I love, but I've found that lately I've become a more patient person then I ever was in the past. I've found that when others start cutting another person down, I'm not all that willing to jump in. I'm nice to everyone, even those that don't deserve it, because I want to be. I don't want to be responsible for causing someone more hurt or pain when everyone out there has more then their share in one for or another. I'm not sure why my Grandpa and Aunt's passing has brought all this to me...but it has, and I'm thankful. I've opened my eyes up alot. Life for me is going on....and I'm glad.

It's been months since my last update, and if you want me to be honest I really didn't ever plan on updating again.  But, lately I've had so much on my mind that I need to get it all out of my head and this is the only place I have to turn.

I've been homesick lately.  Alot.  Then again, maybe it's not homesick so much as it is that I wish I were younger again.  Wish I could be back in high school when I thought my life was SO complicated....but looking back now, I realize just how simple it really was and just how trivial my problems were.  I miss the days I'd get up and go to school, go to cheerleading practice, come home for dinner, and then sit in front of the computer chatting away with my many far away friends (who were my best friends at the time, but now I've lost touch with most all of them) while I half heartedly did my homework.  I think about those days alot lately.  And it's not that I don't love where my life is now.  Life away from home....it's an adventure.  Life with Mike....it's exciting.  My life in general, is great.  In many ways I'm happy and excited about all that is to come.  In other ways, I feel scared and alone.  Scared of change.  Wanting to revert back to old, familiar ways because they were secure and safe for me.  Alone because in reality, I have no one but Mike in my life.  I've grown apart from most all of my friends.  Sara.....she's still my friend, but we aren't as close as before.  She has a boyfriend now, I have Mike....she works two jobs, I spend most of my time at my one.  Our friendship is still that, but that's changed.  Charlie....my best friend ever since he moved here in eighth grade.  We started growing apart before I ever left home, but not it's more so then ever.  Sure, if we run into each other we say hi and talk for awhile.  If I'm at the mall, I'll stop in Hot Topic if I see him working.  But, I don't go out of my way to get a hold of him or make plans and nor does he do that for me.

Change.  It's inevitable for all of us.  We can't escape it because it's all around us.  We change.  Our friends change.  Our way of life changes.  We can fight it all we want too, but it comes and alot of the time we don't even realize it was here until it's done and over with.  Change is scary.  Change is exciting.  Change is a million different emotions and feelings, all wrapped up into one six letter little word.  I look forward to change.  But I also dread it at the same time.  A big part of me would love to go back to when life was simpler.  When all I had to worry about was that major math test on Friday and which shoes look better with these jeans.  Back to a time when the highlight of my day was sitting on the internet chatting on instant messenger.  

You know who I really miss when I have thoughts like this?!  Fleet.  May he forever rest in peace.  He always knew what to say.  That would be nice right now.  Having someone to talk too who would know just the right thing to say.

Wow....been some time since I had the chance to actually get online and write.  Lots to write about now too....

Still with Mike and things are still going great. I just found out not to long ago that......we're going to have a baby.  I was shocked at first.  A little upset.  Scared at the idea of telling my parents (my mom is very religious and I was convinced my dad would disown me).  But after the shock wore off, I had this awesome feeling off.....finally.  I've always wanted kids, but I pictured it happening years down the road when I was more financially secure and prepared.  But...the best things in life don't always wait for us to be prepared for them.  I told Mike and at first he didn't know what to think or say, but now he is happy and brags to everyone that he's going to be a daddy.  As for me telling my parents, I told my mom first.  She took it better then I thought, she was disappointed about me having a baby out of wedlock but she took it alright.  She gave me a lecture about birth control....and for the record I WAS on birth control when I got pregnant!!!!  So, girls out there on birth control and reading this....be warned, just because your on it doesn't mean it will work.  I've been on the pill for years, and I still got pregnant.  A friend of mine was on the patch and she became pregnant.  It happens.  I'm proof.  But, anyways.  I was working on the nerve to tell my dad....he was the hardest because he gets upset/angry and it's not fun.  To my surprise, he took it a million times better then my mom.  He was like; "I'm going to be a grandpa!!!" and he was happy.  He gave me a hug, told me he loved me, and told me to make sure I took good care of myself and took my vitamins.  

Anyways, that's the biggest news.  Actually....it's about the only news.  I'm still working lots of hours and make my $$$.  Mike and I are looking at buying a house and we have one in mind.  And, all in all, I'm very happy right now.  Happy with where my life is headed, happy with where I'm at right now.

Hopefully, I'll be back soon to write some more.  

Until then....

Well, not much new really but since I was at my dad's and bored I figured I would stop on and update.

Things with Mike and I are going well.  He's planning on buying me an engagement ring very soon and I can't wait.  I adore him more then I have ever adored anyone.  I'm glad things are finally falling into place in my life.  I've waited so long for this.

I got my first tattoo.  I ended up getting a pink dolphin on the back of my right shoulder.  It's so freaking cute and everyone who sees it loves it.  It has small baby blue swirls (supposed to look like water) around it and the dolphin itself is a bright pink with baby blue eyes.  It didn't hurt bad to get done, just a little uncomfortable at points.  And a few days after it was done, it began to itch sooooo bad and I wasn't allowed to itch it. 

Aight, time to go raid the 'fridge before I head home.

Wow, it's been over a month since the last time I wrote.  Didn't realize it had been so long.  Part of it's because I couldn't remember my login name for the life of me.  

Life's going.  For the most part, things are going great and heading in a positive direction.  Of course, there have been some hard times.  Lately, I'm going through a hard time where money is concerened.  Seems like I just can't get enough of it.  I pretty much pay my bills just barely on time and don't have any extra to spend on anything.  Living on your own isn't all it's cracked up to be.  But, I've been saving money and budgeting well and by next month I should have a descent amount saved up and be back to having extra spending money again.  Just have to stay level headed.

Mike and I are doing great.  We're talking about getting married, but not sure when we want this to happen (this summer, most likely).  We aren't engaged yet, but I think that's going to happen soon.  I'm really happy with him and I love him more then I ever though you could love someone.  He feels the same, according to a friend of mine who he talked with one night.  She told me he kept telling her how much he loved me and how happy he was.  There have been times in the past where I've loved and thought I couldn't live without the person....but things would happen and life would go on and I'd realize that I could live without them.  This time though, I really do belive I found the one person I can not live without.  I can't even think of life without him.  If I lost him, I don't think I'd ever look for someone else...because I'd always compare them to him and what he's done for me.

My horroscope today has kept me positive: A favor you did for someone a long time ago is about to be repaid, but you won't see it coming. You've probably forgotten all about it -- but they haven't. 

Aight, time for me to take off.  I have a messy apartment to clean *sigh*.

I tried laying out in the sun for awhile, but it's just one of those days where it's too hot.  Trying to work on my tan since I'm going to North Carolina tonight.  Didn't mention the trip sooner because I didn't know until just a half hour ago I was going.  Mike and a few people he works with are going there tomorrow for their work and they had enough room for one more so he told me I could go with them.  I figured, why not?!  I have the next couple days off from work and it'll be nice to get outta here for a bit.

I ended up finding not only white, but also a pink neon light kit for my car.  Problem is....the white and pink kits both start at $169.99...while if I stick with red as I planned it's only $99.  If I were still living at home, it would be a no-brainer...I'd decide between doing white as I wanted, or re-doing my car pink.  But, I gotta do the responsible thing now so I'm going to think it out and then either start saving up for white or go with red (pink is going to have to be outta the question, unfortunatly....in order to do pink I'd have to re-do my seat covers, wheel cover, and re-paint over some of the other red I did...kinda sucks because pink would be so cute).  

We ended up getting absolutely killed at work last night.  It was one big disaster.  Poor Deziree was the only other server on (besides me) and every customer she had was just miserable and bitchy.  I love that girl to death, but she JUST came back after being gone for awhile and she isn't back in the swing of things fully yet; so she was struggling on top of trying to deal with people giving her a hard time.  I kept taking as many tables as I possibly could so she could keep up with the ones she had.  We both ended up making good money. 

Alright, I'm going to go out and help my dad out in the garden.  I love digging and doing things out there for some reason.  Who would of thought I would like gardening?!

Ugh...no matter how much I sleep lately, it seems I'm still not getting enough.  I'm always either tired or in a `zone'.  

Things have been going well.  I still love living on my own, but miss home sometimes.  Had one of those moments yesterday where I found myself wishing I was at home.  It was so much easier to save money and so much less stress, in some ways.  But, I'm doing well on my own-better then lots of my friends are or have done.  Luckily, saving money has always been a strong point for me.

I'm going to be starting a second job soon, and I can't wait.  I'm going to be working through a center for disabled and elderly.  Basically, your encouranged to get them out and about since they are unable too on their own.  You get paid to take them to the mall, out to eat, and to just hang out with them.  I know a girl who took one of the people to Six Flags for the day...and got paid for it!!  How neat is that?!  And it's not just the money....I sincerely like the idea of being able to hang out with someone and take them places they can't go on their own.  

Well, time for me to go clean all the junk outta my car (since Mike promised he'd vaccuum it out for me after he gets outta work) and go lay in the sun for a bit.  Ta-ta.

I was in a good mood all day and kept trying to ignore his bad mood. Then, I'm at work last night and he comes over and gets in a confrontation with a guy I work with that is a friend of mine and that is what finally set me over the edge.  I think he knew he had finally pushed me too far after the incident.  He spent the rest of the night texting me on my phone and apologizing.  He even showed up later on that night to hang out with me at work for a little bit.  I told him I forgive him, but it better not happen again.  I don't forgive for the same thing twice.  When I got out of work he was in a good mood, but I wasn't.  

I can't say I'm still in a bad mood today, just feel a bit down.  Hopefully, that will all change.  I'm heading out fishing this afternoon after my dentist appointment. There were a ton of cards from them...and inside the cards?!  The money they had given me back then which added up to over $300 with all the cards put together.  My dad didn't give me the money back then, because he said he didn't want me to waste it on some toy that I'd only play with for a little while and then eventually throw out.  He wanted to wait until I was older and could use it on something truely meaningful.  I thought that was awesome.  The money was a nice bonus....but it was the cards that ment more to me then anything. Reading those cards helped me feel closer to them.  

My Aunt Clara....I have almost no memory of her at all (I was 5 or 6 when she died), except for one.  I remember she had a friend who owned a candy shop.  She used to take me there once a week and her friend would let me pick out anything I wanted....I always picked out Tootsie Rolls.  It's my only memory of her....other then the ones I can see on my dad's old home videos he used to take (but I don't count those...because if it weren't for the video, I'd never remember those moments).  My Grandma on my dad's side...my memories of her have faded over time.  I remember going to her house Trick or Treating and I remember her letting my cousin Melissa and I spend the night over there together.  She used to watch the Price Is Right every day without fail.  I still remember, like it was yesterday, coming out of church school and my dad and mom in the car waiting for me (which I thought was odd...since they were divorced and kinda bitter towards each other on and off at that point). The past and the people in it are best left in it.  I didn't used to believe that, but after lots of thinking-I now do.  People come into your life for a reason.  We don't always know what this reason is, but it's there.  I'm grateful for every person who has ever affected my life in any way.  I'm grateful they were brought into my life for whatever reason and stayed around for awhile.  But, people grow up.  People change.  Our needs, wants, and dreams change with us.  What may of been right for us then is sometimes not what is right for us now.  I know what is right for me now.  I know what I want out of my life and who I want to be in it.  Nothing anyone says will change that or bring me down or cause me to doubt my choices.  Because in my heart of hearts, I already know the path I'm supposed to take-and I'm on it.  Will the path be a happy, trouble free path?!  Probably not.  Why?!  Because I know the happy, trouble free path and it's the one I choose not to take.  I don't want a predictable life.  I want the path untraveled.  I want the one with bends, and sharp turns, pot holes, bumps.  I want a life full of surprises, good or bad.  My friends can support my decisions and trust that I know I'm doing whats right for me right now.  Or, they can cut me down, disagree, and think I'm crazy...and in that case, I will wish them a good and happy life and let them go.  Because if you can't support me, you aren't my real friend and I have no room in my life for you.

I don't have time to be unhappy or hateful.  I'm not going to spend my life hating or being angry because that's not the life for me.  Instead, I'll forgive what I can forgive, forget what I can forget, and accept what I can not forgive or forget.  I'm going to live my life one day at a time.  I won't obsess over the past, because it's unchangeable.  I won't worry about the future because all the worrying in the world won't stop it from arriving.  I'll just take today for what it is and make the most out of every second.  I will take time out of everyday to talk with my dad, mom, and brother.  I will treat them like each day is their last...because you never really do know when you'll be right.  I will no longer take their unconditional love and acceptance for granted.  They are the ones who have been there for me since the beginning...they will be the ones standing there and still loving me at the end of time.  My friends...my second family....the brothers and sisters God forgot to give me.  Always there in a heartbeat with a smile to laugh with or a shoulder to cry on.  Their love means more then anything to me...because they don't have to love me....they choose too.

I had this dream last night that was so amazingly real that it's hard for me to believe it didn't happen.  In a way, the dream did happen once....three years ago.  Before I can talk about the dream, I have to go back to three years ago and a night I knew I'd always remember.

I was early April 2001, I was in Alaska...on my own personal adventure.  I'd made lots of friends there, as with an Army and Air Force base right in the area there were all kinds of people my age always around.  Two guys I used to hang out with alot were Gabriel and Ben.  They were nothing more then just good friends of mine.  Both were in the Air Force, both nice guys my age or close to it.  And I remember one night they wanted to take me out to a bon fire at a friend of their's.  We all stood around the fire and I met lots of interesting people, people I knew I'd probably never meet again, and enjoyed their company.  Half way through the night I noticed something I'd never seen before...the Northern Lights.  The sky was lit up with beautiful shades of green...red...blue...and to top it off, the stars were out and brighter then ever.  I wanted to see it better, so Gabriel walked me over to a nearby semi-truck (it belonged to the guy who's house we were at, he drove it for a living around Alaska).  He helped me climb up to the very top of it, took off his sweatshirt (despite the chill in the air) so I'd have a pillow, and we layed there for well over an hour just watching.  I still remember when I was laying there that night...I wished that moment could last forever.  I knew at that moment...that it would be a night I would never forget.  It was nothing special, just me, a new friend, laying atop a semi in the middle of Alaska, watching the stars and the Northern Lights.  I remember not wanting that night to ever end.  Seems like it was just last night when I think about it.  But it wasn't last night.  It was like a blinked and suddenly here I am, three years later.

My dream last night is what helped me remember that night, a little more clearly.  Except, in my dream...it was NOW.  Not three years ago, but it was like it was happening last night.  I was standing at the bon fire, everyone that was there three years ago was there in my dream.  Once again, the Northern Lights flared up and I wanted to go somewhere secluded, dark, and away from the fire to just enjoy them.  Gabriel and I walk back to the semi and he once again helps me climb to the top.  Only this time we don't lay down...we sit, indian style and facing each other, on top.  He looks at me for a second and finally says; "Just wanted you to know, I've missed you and still think of you often".  He says that, and my eyes tear up and I respond; "I've missed all of you too so much.  I wondered if you guys would wait for my return".  And his response to me is; "You should of known we all were waiting here for you".  Then, Ben starts yelling for Gabriel...telling him it's time for him to go.  He tells me he needs to go and offers to help me off the semi.  I shake my head, I don't need help off and I'm not ready to go.  He hugs me, climbs down, and I sit alone....and I'm content.

Not sure where that dream came from...all I know, is it really made me remember alot of the people I "forgot" about after three years.  As for Ben and Gabriel, I kept in touch with them for almost a year or so after I came home from Alaska.  Unfortunatly, I have since lost touch with both and have no possible way of tracking either of them down anymore.  I still think about them from time to time, hope they are happy and that life is going their way.  I wonder if they ever think of me...if they miss me....if they are out there somewhere, wishing they could get a hold of me.  Somethings in life, we will never know.  But my dream last night brought the memory of them back to me stronger then it has been in almost three years.  And it reminded me that they are still out there, and that I still miss them and their friendship.  Knowing that I'll probably never talk to or see them ever again sucks.  But, I wouldn't trade having the chance to know them for the short time I did for anything.  All I have now are the memories and a picture of Gabriel.  I have no picture of Ben though, only the one in my mind.

Gabriel & Ben: I hope life brings you happiness always.  Thanks for giving me your friendship.  Thanks for the memories.  Miss you...

If you must speak badly of someone, don't speak it, but write it -- in the sand, at the water's edge, near the waves. 

Courage does not always roar. Sometimes, it is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, "I will try again tomorrow".

Many times the difference between failure and success is doing something nearly right or doing it exactly right. 

Resolve to be tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving, and tolerant with the weak and wrong because sometime in your life, you will have been all of these. 

Some people dream of success while others wake up and work hard at it. 

What you do, not what you say, defines who you are. 

Travel the path of integrity without looking back, for there is never a wrong time to do the right thing. 

Forgiveness is the scent that the rose leaves on the heel that crushes it.

Be who you are and say what you want, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.

If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day, so I never have to live without you.

When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, "I used everything you gave me."

A pedestal is as much a prison as any other small space.

Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work, so most people don't recognize them. 

I still miss those I loved who are no longer with me but I find I am grateful for having loved them. The gratitude has finally conquered the loss.

I would rather die a meaningful death than to live a meaningless life.

The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.

What is said when drunk has been thought out beforehand. 

You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you. 

Tact is the knack of making a point without making an enemy.

We are inclined to believe those whom we do not know because they have never deceived us.
